qas.question: What was the date when Arizona was bought?
What year did the Overland Mail Corporation end operations?
What was the name of the deal in which Arizona was bought?
Arizona is south of which river?
In what year did Tuscon become a stage station?
Where did the US buy land from in the Gadsden Purchase?
When did the US formally take control of the Tucson area?
When did the mail stagecoaches stop running?
Why did the mail stagecoaches stop running?

answers.text: devastating Apache attacks on the stations and coaches

context: Arizona, south of the <a3_0>Gila River<a3_0/> was legally bought from <a6_0>Mexico<a6_0/> in the <a2_0>Gadsden Purchase<a2_0/> on <a0_0><a5_0>June 8, 1854<a5_0/><a0_0/>. Tucson became a part of the United States of America, although the American military did not formally take over control until <a7_0>March 1856<a7_0/>. In <a4_0>1857<a4_0/> Tucson became a stage station on the San Antonio-San Diego Mail Line and in 1858 became 3rd division headquarters of the Butterfield Overland Mail until the line shut down in March 1861. The Overland Mail Corporation attempted to continue running, however following the Bascom Affair, <a9_0>devastating Apache attacks on the stations and coaches<a9_0/> ended operations in <a8_0>August <a1_0>1861<a8_0/><a1_0/>.[citation needed]
